name: emanation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of producing something or of expressing a quality or feeling : Human language is an emanation of the human mind. Constitutional law should be treated as the emanation of the popular will. See
emanate
More examplesFewer examplesThe production is the latest emanation from the ever-fertile imagination of the artistic director. the emanation of lightMy book, this emanation from my brain, is designed to amuse myself, with hopes that there are others who might enjoy it too.
